name: The Corner House Hotel

reviews.text: A Birthday Celebration was organised at the Hotel and a room booked for me. The Reception was good and the meal (for +20 people) was efficiently served and for the most part of good quality. Breakfast the following morning was also good. I had asked for a "pleasant" room which cost me £100 p.n., a suplement of £25 on the standard room. It was on the ground floor and approx. 5m x 5m. There was a very high ceiling. The decor was cold and the furnishing very utilitarian - open wardrobe and shelving (no draws) and an MFI table with only a straight chair. I stayed at a Travel-lodge for £29 the week before that had much more atmosphere about it. The bed was kingsize. In the corner was a "porta-cabin" that rose to about two-thirds the height of the room, which held the shower etc and which had an opaque glass door that did not fit. There was complimentary water. The small bottle of red wine (contents of which were not complimentary) was used to prop open the large sash-window which insisted on falling gilloutine-like without it. If I'd paid an extra £25 on top of £50 I would still have been critical. When I told reception that I was disappointed with the room I was told that it was the biggest in the hotel! It did provide parking.
reviews.title: Food Good - Rooms Awfull

reviews.text: We took my elderly parents to see some relatives and needed a hotel in Taunton for Bed and Breakfast with one room on the ground floor. The Hotel was described as 3 star, the evening meal was 4 star plus and the service was 5 star. How nice to find owner managers who are so enthusuiastic to provide the best that they can.
reviews.title: Family weekend break

reviews.text: The Breakfast on the Sunday morning used local poduce and was the best that we have had in many years.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay with delicious food!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights in a room over looking the carpark - I could hardly hear the busy road at all and slept well, only being disturbed by the people in the room next to me when they were entering and exiting their room. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. The only thing I would change would be to have bath in the bathroom. I would recommend requesting a room with a bath when you're making your booking if you'd like one.
reviews.title: Stay at Corner House Hotel, Taunton

reviews.text: I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but had dinner and thought the food was delicious. Although the service could have been a bit quicker, the portions are big and I can't recommend the sticky toffee pudding dessert enough - absolutely devine!
reviews.title: Susie List

reviews.text: Spent two nights at hotel in September 2011, first room had only half an interior double glazed window, room noisy from road as a result and only hotel room where I have had to sleep in fleece and socks as so cold (radiator did not work either). Changed room next day (fully booked on first noght so could not help me! but then was embarrased by staff as I HAD paid for Bed, Breakfast and Dinner, but they wanted to charge me for the food, eventually resolved when I produced my booking form.
reviews.title: Rooms Really bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poorly treated, no real apology and no compensation, not even as a good will gesture for everything that was wrong with the stay. Would not recommend this to anyone. The Dinner menu was good and staff pleasent but breakfast was a joke, asked for scrambled egg on toast and got a salty omelette which was inedible!
reviews.title: Lovely staff and great food

reviews.text: Sorry folks but look elsewhere is my advice, if you have to stay here then make sure you take your booking forms etc as proof of payment etc.
reviews.title: Ok place to stay, decent food and bar but the rooms need upgrading

reviews.text: We stayed here in September 2011. It was a random choice on the internet and a good one it turned out to be. The receptionist was lovely on our arrival and although our room was very small, it was described as compact, so we were half expecting it. I loved the blue paint in the entrance/bar/restaurant areas and the white printed signs on the paintwork. The wall of wine was eye catching too. The 'early diner' menu was lovely although my husband's chocolate mousse was still frozen when it came and very amusing to watch him eat! Again the staff were super and very friendly which contributed to the atmosphere in the hotel. Breakfast was varied and good value. The room was ok although I had very little room on my side of the bed. There were however, lovely touches with cold milk and bottled water in the fridge. Parts of the hotel are tired but I really enjoyed my stay because of the staff.
reviews.title: restuarant lovely, room awful

reviews.text: I stayed here on business in September, this Hotel gets quite a lot right in that it has a small but comfortable bar area with a good range of drinks and the food in the restaurant is good and well presented, the breakfast is also good but the service could be sharper. There is an ok atmosphere to the place and the staff are friendly and mostly efficient, there is also free parking. The downside are the rooms which are very much hit and miss, the bathroom in my room was very cramped to say the least making it awkward and the room generally needed some modernisation. All in all its a reasonable place to have a short stay but could be so much better if the rooms were sorted.
reviews.title: Nice hotel shame about the bedrooms

reviews.text: Got an excellent deal (50% off) for a compact room but were upgraded (without asking) to a standard room. Very friendly receptionist, made us feel welcome. Shame we weren't told restaurant was fully booked for the evening. When we returned to our room after a short walk we went downstairs to eat only to be informed that they had no room. We had to get all dressed up again and go in search of somewhere! (Temperature was well below freezing that evening)
reviews.title: Needs some attention.

reviews.text: Points to note
reviews.title: Cut price offer - top class service

reviews.text: 1) The window in our room didn't close properly so noise (from smokers?) in alleyway can be clearly heard.
reviews.title: Corner House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) The bed was far too soft giving very little support.
reviews.title: Very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) Partition wall very thin so could clearly hear conversation next door.
reviews.title: A lovely well run and friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel despite us having a very small room described as compact and being on a busy road. It didnt spoil the experience however as we had got a very good deal on late rooms and indeed the room had everything that was needed including nice toileteries, flat screen tv, big towels, mini fridge which didnt cost a fortune, iron,fresh milk and even a fresh flower!!!! Probably could have done with a few more hangers... The hotel itself has a lovely homely feel to it and has a wonderful history with gothic revival features. There is a wine shop actually on site with special deals on bottles if you eat in the restaurant (wine and sausage) - which we did. We were glad we did as the food was extremely good and reasonable. The staff were extremely friendly and breakfast was second to none.Good for shopping as everything close and free parking at the hotel and walkable. Will definatley be staying here again.(might try a larger room next time)
reviews.title: Small but Beautiful!

reviews.text: As we were in the area for a funeral,a quick search on the internet for accomodation and struck gold with the Corner House hotel in Taunton.The service was first class,the food excellent the rooms were comfortable and kept to a high standard of cleanliness and all at a very reasonable price .Advice from the friendly staff about the area was spot on as we had never been in the location before.
reviews.title: 3 star hotel with 5star service.

reviews.text: Will be in the location next year for a short break and will be using the Corner House as a base
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: W Drury.
reviews.title: Not turned the corner yet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly, helpful and efficient staff both at front desk, in bar,and in the restaurant. Room small but well heated and ventilated, comfy bed, and efficient bathroom. Restaurant had a good choice of vegetarian food and the beer was well kept. Breakfast good as well.
reviews.title: excellence

description: ‘A new breed of hotel for the centre of Taunton.’ Within walking distance of the centre of Somerset’s County town, this 44 bedroom hotel has been transformed to meet the demands of the modern day traveller. ‘Budget boutique’ was one observer’s comment. The recent addition of the Wine & Sausage eating rooms has been well received by hotel residents and locals alike. Ideal for business or pleasure. Emphasis has been placed on developing a simple yet stylish and comfortable sleeping experience at an affordable price. All rooms have linen duvets, ample work space, refrigerators with complimentary bottled water and fresh milk, flat screen televisions and sparkling en-suite facilities. Free Wi-fi is available throughout the hotel. A flexible combination of meeting and eating rooms and excellent road and rail connections make the Corner House a convenient location for day and residential meetings. The hotel has free on site car parking and is in an ideal location for visiting many of the nearby Somerset attractions or as a stopover en-route to or from the Cornish peninsula.
